perturbation.original_text: a. Schoolpop shall have the exclusive right to resell Cards in                   the NPO Marketplace. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Schoolpop                   shall fund from AEIS a minimum of $52,000,000 of Cards (the                   "Guaranteed Minimum") in each Contract Year in order to                   maintain the exclusive right to sell Cards in the NPO                   Marketplace. A Contract Year shall be the period of August 1                   through July 31 of the succeeding year. In any Contract Year                   in which Schoolpop fails to fund the Guaranteed Minimum, AEIS                   shall have the right, in its sole discretion, to (a) terminate                   the Agreement or (b) revoke the exclusivity.
perturbation.changed_text: a. Schoolpop shall have the exclusive right to resell Cards in                   the NPO Marketplace. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Schoolpop                   shall fund from AEIS a minimum of $52,000,000 of Cards (the                   "Guaranteed Minimum") in each Contract Year in order to                   maintain the exclusive right to sell Cards in the NPO                   Marketplace. A Contract Year shall be any period of time agreed upon verbally by both parties. In any Contract Year                   in which Schoolpop fails to fund the Guaranteed Minimum, AEIS                   shall have the right, in its sole discretion, to (a) terminate                   the Agreement or (b) revoke the exclusivity.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract defines a 'Contract Year' as a specific period (August 1 to July 31). The modification changes this definition to 'any period of time agreed upon verbally by both parties.' This introduces ambiguity because verbal agreements are difficult to prove and enforce, contradicting the original intention of a clearly defined term. It affects enforcement by making it uncertain when the 'Guaranteed Minimum' must be met.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Clear and unambiguous terms

perturbation.original_text: k.       CARDS LOST OR STOLEN IN TRANSIT IN THE INITIAL SHIPMENT FROM                   AEIS WILL BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF AEIS. The full risk of loss                   for ordered Cards shall pass to Schoolpop immediately upon                   their delivery to Schoolpop by AEIS and AEIS shall not                   reimburse Schoolpop or Client for any delivered Card that is                   lost, stolen, misappropriated, or that otherwise disappears or                   is fraudulently or inappropriately used (together referred to as "Loss"). Schoolpop shall remain solely liable for any Loss                   caused by the negligence or willful misconduct of its                   employees, agents or representatives after the shipment has                   been received by Schoolpop. AEIS will not reimburse Schoolpop                   or its Client or be responsible for any Loss in connection                   with or after delivery of Cards to Schoolpop, its Clients or                   the Cardholder whether they are shipped to Schoolpop, its                   Client, or to either of their pre-designated delivery agents.                   Only Cardholders are eligible to receive replacements from                   AEIS and replacements are given only in accordance with the                   agreement between the Cardholder and AEIS. Cards are usually                   shipped in packaging with AEIS' designated vendor as the                   return address. Notwithstanding the foregoing, AEIS shall bear                   no risk of Loss and of non-receipt of Cards by the intended                   Cardholder in the event that AEIS is instructed to use another                   address as the return address, the address provided to AEIS                   for Schoolpop or the Client was incorrect, the request for the                   Card was unauthorized, and/or any information received by AEIS                   with regard to the processing of the Order was fraudulent or                   incorrect.

perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies Schoolpop is responsible for the losses caused by negligence of its employees. The modified term makes Schoolpop liable for any Loss deemed "reasonable by AEIS, regardless of fault". This contradicts standard business practices where liability requires fault and creates uncertainty. The enforcement is uncertain because AEIS gets unilateral power to assign liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Standard of Care and Liability

perturbation.explanation: The original limitation of liability is defined as the lesser of $50,000 or the amount paid by Schoolpop in the preceding 12 months. Modifying this to an amount 'determined at AEIS's discretion, but potentially up to $50,000' makes the liability limit indefinite. It contradicts contract law principles requiring certainty in essential terms. Enforcement becomes uncertain as the actual limitation is subject to AEIS's whim.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Definite and ascertainable terms; Good Faith and Fair Dealing
